results.title: Australia's most expensive tick
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Extensive research is uncovering a great deal of information about the cattle tick which costs the beef industry of Northern Australia millions of dollars each year.

results.title: The Sun goes to work...at home
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
It looks like any other suburban Australian house, but in fact it’s a highly efficient laboratory built in Melbourne for the CSIRO. The purpose is to see how much fuel costs can be reduced by a combination of good insulation, efficient design and an innovative solar heating system.

results.title: Siroseeder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Siroseeder is a machine designed to spray a herbicide, cultivate the soil in narrow rows, insert seed and fertilizer at a predetermined depth, replace the soil and press it down lightly. Normally. farmers could use four implements and make up to eight passes to do the same job. If these and other experiments are fruitful, inputs of time, labour and fuel will fall dramatically, as will the risk of soil erosion.

results.title: Please don't pick the daisies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The Snowy Mountains of South East Australia, despite their rugged, unchanging appearance are, in reality, quite fragile and quite sensitive to the forces of nature and the presence of people. The wild beauty of Kosciusko’s alpine flora is recorded by a research team for a new book.

results.title: Fire can be a friend
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Fire is a natural part of the Australian environment. Fire has been such a dominant factor that many native plants are adapted to periodic burning. Due to the supression of natural fires many square kilometres are being choked by a dense sea of invading shrubs.

results.title: An Open book for the disabled
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Displays an automated microfiche reader developed at CSIRO’s Division of Manufacturing Technology in Adelaide, which promises to make the printed word more readily accessible to the physically handicapped.

results.title: New mineral detector
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Sirotem embodies Australian solutions to the shortcomings of overseas electronic devices trying to detect minerals hidden beneath our difficult types of soil. Sirotem foreshadows the development of other exploration tools from this revolutionary Australian technology.

results.title: Life sentence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mick Jackson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Real thing”.
Part 6 of a series examining the latest research into the workings of the human brain. This film considers language and human use of it, noting how the meaning of a word can be changed by altering the pitch of the spoken word; how incorrect sentences can be corrected by the listener or the receiver of the information; how the use of grammar can change the information; how the use of grammar can change the meaning of words; and how many different concepts and associations can surround the use of one word, eg cat or girl. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The View from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Real thing”.
Looks at the complexity of the brain handling the simplest activity, like going to a party. James Burke’s consciousness steps out of his body for a while to demonstrate how it acts as “mission controller” for his own private universe
